channel.title: SFist
channel.description: SFist is a website about San Francisco.Editor: Brock Keeling Publisher: Gothamist

item.title: Day Around The Bay: Here Come The Bank Bros
item.description: In Friday's evening roundup: bankers move west, the city without cars, Willie Brown at the mall food court, Central Subway updates, and more. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Four Dead After Woman Goes On A Rampage At Northern California Tribal Headquarters
item.description: Thursday afternoon at the headquarters of Cedarville Rancheria Northern Paiute tribe, a federally recognized tribe near the Oregon border, 44-year-old former tribal leader Cherie Lash Rhoades opened fire during an eviction hearing that could have kicked her and her son off the reservation. Rhoades shot four people in a hearing room and another who tried to flee, before she retrieved a butcher knife and charged after one of her shooting victims. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Warning: Poisonous Meatballs Return To Twin Peaks [Updated]
item.description: We're getting word from a Twin Peaks resident that poisoned meatballs, which injured at least three dogs, are possibly back. The latest alleged sighting was at 80 Crestline. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Thanks to This Week's Advertisers
item.description:
We would like to take a moment to thank this week's advertisers on SFist.

  • Mercedes-Benz. Check out the redesigned 2014 E-Class.
  • Mixology. One bar. One night. Ten single people. Welcome to Mix. Premieres Wednesday, February 26th on ABC.
  • Asian Art Museum. Proximities, A Three-Part Exhibition. On view May 24, 2013 - February 23, 2014.
  • American Apparel, with 3 stores in SF, you can look your best any time.
  • How About We, for people who understand that you don't date online.

If you're interested in advertising on SFist or any other site in our network, check out our online mediakit.


[ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Morgan Walters

item.title: Have You Seen This Violent Sex Offender?
item.description: He also reportedly goes by the alias "Kevin Bacon," among others. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Animal Roundup: Baby Giraffe, Ailing K9, Incredibly Old Raccoon
item.description: This week in Animal Roundup, we hear about the SF Zoo's big baby, a dog who needs your help, and a raccoon who could go to high school. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: The Mill Launches A Weekly Pizza Night
item.description: After a brief test run last year, noted toast emporium The Mill on Divisadero has announced they'll be expanding their lineup of doughy items when they roll out a weekly pizza night every Monday starting in March. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Man Quits Google Because Of 'Congested, Racist, Incestuous, And Overpriced' Bay Area
item.description: A man dislikes the Bay Area so much he's quitting his well paid job at Google. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: Photo Du Jour: Your Future Housing
item.description: Mid-Market residential growth in action, shot by Gerard Livernois. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Woman Dies After Being Struck By Cement Truck In Pac Heights
item.description: An 91-year-old woman crossing Fillmore Street on Thursday afternoon was struck and killed by a cement truck heading north past California. According to SFPD, the woman was taken to San Francisco General where she received surgery, but later succumbed to her injuries. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: SF Strip Clubs Want To Get UC Berkeley Co-Eds Naked
item.description: Who says there are no non-tech jobs available in San Francisco? [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: Giants Speak Out Against Bryan Stow's Attackers
item.description: In exchange for plea bargains, Marvin Norwood and Louis Sanchez received four and eight year sentences, respectively, for the brutal 2011 beating of Giants fan Bryan Stow outside Dodgers Stadium. Several noted Giants had something to say about Stow's attackers. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Alleged Mission Bank Robber Nabbed
item.description: A man suspected of robbing a Mission District bank was recognized by police just a few blocks from the scene of the crime. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: World's Brightest Girl Scout Sells Cookies Outside San Francisco Marijuana Dispensary
item.description: Girl Scout sets up cookie stand in front of San Francisco medical marijuana dispensary, unloads 117 boxes in only two hours. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Kaepernick Confirms 49ers Would Be Cool With Gay Teammate
item.description: Following on a rumor last week that a San Francisco 49er was set to the come out of the closet very soon, quarterback Colin Kaepernick just made a public statement saying... [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Jay Barmann

item.title: Friday Morning Constitutional: First Loves
item.description: In Friday's morning roundup: love notes, a reckless Seahawk, a beer hall, false advertising, breaking & entering and more. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Day Around The Bay: Lincecum Wins
item.description: Today in Day Around the Bay: Zionist group pushes for legal action against Palestinian student group, investigating the Peet's around Cal, people into taxing soda, billion dollar dreams, and more. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Happy Birthday, Patty Hearst!
item.description: SF heiress turned bank robber turned cult cameo maker turns 60 today. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: 'Everything But The News' Takes On S.F. Ridesharing
item.description: Everything But The News is a news parody show, similar to The Daily Show, but with more PBS-focused jokes. In it, freelance reporter/out and proud Canadian Steve Goldbloom ventures throughout the Bay Area to get the word on the latest and greatest in tech. He's funny. The show, thus far, is funny. And they just did this report on San Francisco ridesharing. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Two Construction Workers Seriously Injured After Scaffolding Collapses In SoMa
item.description: One construction worker fell 40 feet and another fell 30 feet while installing a scaffolding at a construction site at 350 Mission Street in SoMa this afternoon. According to San Francisco Fire Department spokesperson Mindy Talmadge, both workers were taken to the hospital to be treated for life-threatening injuries. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: S.F. Sex Toy Business Slurped Up By Holding Company
item.description: SF sex toy company Jimmyjane has entered into a marriage with a company one industry insider describes as the "leader in low-quality products, unsafe materials, fraudulent packaging." [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve

item.title: Bryan Stow's Attackers Plead Guilty, Family Rips Them Apart In Court
item.description: Marvin Norwood and Louis Sanchez pled guilty today to charges related to the 2011 assault of Giants fan Bryan Stow outside of Dodger Stadium. For their actions, which left Stow brain damaged and disabled, the judge called them, "the biggest nightmare for people who attend public events." [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Peter Shih And Greg Gopman: Where Are They Now?
item.description: Six months after his vitriolic screed against homeless people, women and San Francisco in general barfed him into the spotlight, Peter Shih's company Celery picked up a $2 million investment. If Silicon Valley still considers itself a meritocracy, it sure isn't concerned with matters of character. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dalton

item.title: Full House: What If Michelle Was A Figment Of Danny Tanner's Imagination?
item.description: This reimagined version of Full House presents Michelle Tanner as a figment of Danny Tanner's damaged psyche. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: Brock Keeling

item.title: Cal Student Allegedly Gay Bashes, Robs Other Student
item.description: A UC Berkeley student allegedly made homophobic remarks before robbing and beating a classmate. [ more › ]
item.dc:creator: eve
